entry.content:
Appropriate for the date:
Does anyone have any idea how my parents (in their early 60s), and some others their age, came by their belief that the American Revolution was fought — and won — entirely or almost entirely by independent, disorganized individuals armed only with their hunting rifles, slipping through the woods in primitive camouflage, picking off the British who "were sitting ducks, standing in the open in neat lines wearing their bright red coats, like morons," and said British doing nothing but impotently protesting "that's just not cricket!" as these lone Patriots violated all the contemporary "rules" of war — "were terrorists," as my Mom put it? In short, that the Revolution was fought and won through lone-wolf terrorism.
